content.description:
BETA: Starts on a really good ledge (Shown in picture). Bounce up to the next ledge where there are multiple good holds. From there, reach for a protruding rock that has a nice jug. Make your way to the top with a few more good holds. The top hold is a bit slopey.

WARNING: Do not go to far to the right or up. The rocks to the right and up are flaky and ready to break off.

BETA: Start on a really good flake (Shown in Photo). Bounce up to a small edge and match. Reach out to a crimp that you can either match or use other crimps around it. After the crimpy section, move your hands along a few slopers in till you reach the last hold. The last hold is a good sloper. During the whole climb, your legs are underneath the rock and your hands are in the middle of the face.

WARNING: Do not go high and to the left. The rocks are flaky there. Also, DO NOT go farther underneath the rock!! There is a huge flake that could come off. The boulder route does not go near there, so it is safe.

Sit Start, Keyhole shaped pocket for the left hand and a good crack for the right. Work your way up and left into the mid section of the climb then use some deep pockets to get onto a pretty slopey top out.
content.location: Area Two. In an area off the main wall, made up as of two large stand alone rock formations. This climb is on the back side of the formations facing toward the road (route 56).

content.description: There are three main blocks at Area 2. The first block is a pretty big overhang where "Social Anxiety" and "Finger Hanger" are located. Also, the middle of the overhang has a lot of loose rock and flimsy flakes, so be careful. The other two blocks are overgrown with moss and lichens making it hard to climb.
